revised_title: The Morphology and Function of Giant Nerve Cells and Fibres in Halla parthenopeia
tldr: This study investigates the morphology and function of giant nerve cells and fibres in the annelid species Halla parthenopeia. The research focuses on the number, arrangement, size, and general morphology of the giant cells, as well as the giant fibres' sheath, neurofibrillae, and posterior giant cells. The findings provide insights into the structure and function of these remarkable elements in the nervous system.
